title: Display type from a vintage poster
content:
Saw this on a poster in a diner, no luck figuring it out. (I think my original post was flagged as spam)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bmoriginal.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747/http:/typophile.com/files/bmoriginal.jpg) | 617.96 KB |
| [bm.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747/http:/typophile.com/files/bm.jpg) | 233.24 KB |
author: KMoose

comments.content: Nothing really convincing from my side. No name, no track and only few loosely alternatives quite helpless actually: [Concurso Italian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/concurso-italian-btn) and [Friedhof](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/friedhof) Schmal (tuning almost everything...)

Part way there -- about the same width with angled lower stroke on B and R

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AbolitionRoundWilthAltBandR_5557.jpg)
  
Abolition Round by Mattox Shuler, using alt B and R [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150111194747/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hold-fast-foundry/abolition/")  
Don
